full_summary:
# Request for Proposal for Dome Type Prefabricated Building (Hangar) at Sherbrooke Research and Development Center

### Reference Number
`cb-5359-1081913`

### Solicitation Number
`01B46-23-029`

### Publication Date
`2023-05-10`

### Tender Closing Date and Time
`2023-06-02T14:00:00`

### Expected Contract Date Range
`2023-05-31 - 2024-03-31`

### Description
We invite you to submit a proposal for the design, supply, and installation of a domed canvas hangar at the Sherbrooke Research and Development Center (RDC Sherbrooke). The proposed structure will have a 929 m² (10,000 ft²) floor area, a maximum height of 10.7m (35 ft), and will be installed on a concrete block base. This project falls under the procurement category of Construction and Maintenance Services - Construction of Buildings (CNST).

### Notice Type
Request for Proposal (RFP)

### Procurement Method
Competitive - Open Bidding

### Selection Criteria
**Lowest Price**

### Trade Agreements
- Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
- North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)

### Regions of Opportunity
- Canada

### Regions of Delivery
- Sherbrooke

### Procurement Entity Information
- **Name**: Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada
- **Address**: 2001 Robert-Bourassa Boulevard, Montreal, QC H3A 3N2

### Contact Information
- **Agent Name**: Carol Rahal, Contracts Officer
- **Contact Email**: [carol.rahal@agr.gc.ca](mailto:carol.rahal@agr.gc.ca)
- **Phone**: (514) 231-3209

### Available Documents
- Plans and drawings for the proposed project
- Tender documents and specifications

To obtain these documents, please visit [AchatsCanada](https://canadabuys.canada.ca) and follow the outlined procedures. Addenda will be available on the CanadaBuy platform when issued.

### Important Notes
- This project is subject to the Canada Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA).
- It is mandatory to consult the CanadaBuy platform for any addenda and documentation.
- We reserve the right to accept all or part of the proposals received. Bidders must contact the Contract
